definition: to get out of the way

to dodge/to duck out of the way/to beat it/shaken (by a fall)/to sprain/to pull a muscle/lightning/spark/a flash/to flash (across one's mind)/to leave behind/(Internet slang) (of a display of affection) "dazzlingly" saccharine
surname Shan

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: You should not even think about leaving.
Sorry, but this is no place for a little girl. So beat it.
sentences.chinese: 对不起，但是这里没有小女孩的地方，所以闪开。

sentences.english: He swung at me,but missed,and fell.
sentences.chinese: 他挥拳向我击来，被我闪开没打中，他自己却摔倒了。

sentences.english: He dodged cleverly when she threw her shoe at him.
sentences.chinese: 她用鞋子砸向他时，他机敏地闪开了。

sentences.english: Keep your girlfriend out of this.
The fireman told us to keep back.
sentences.chinese: 救火员叫我们闪开，别过来。

sentences.english: He dodged cleverly when the police fired at him .
sentences.chinese: 警察向他开枪时，他机警地闪开了。

sentences.english: "Stand aside, " she said, "and let me pass.

definition: to get out of the way/to step aside
to stay out of (hot water, trouble, awkward situation etc)/to avoid (sb)
to recoil/to draw back/to fall back/to retreat
to dodge
to dodge/to evade
to desist/to stop/to stay one's hand
to dodge/to sidestep
(to stand or move) sideways
to stand
to jump out of the way
to withdraw
to evade/to dodge (out of the way)
to obstruct
backwards/facing back
to charge into
(idiom) no sooner said than done/before you know it
pinyin: shuo1 shi2 chi2 , na4 shi2 kuai4
